revised_title: Fermi Surfaces of Copper, Silver, and Gold: Analyzing the De Haas-Van Alphen Effect
tldr: This article presents the calculation of Fermi surfaces for copper, silver, and gold based on the de Haas-van Alphen effect. The authors fit the Fermi surfaces to experimental data and compare them with other properties like the anomalous skin effect and magneto-acoustic oscillations. The results show that the same Fermi surface can account for both the de Haas-van Alphen effect and the anomalous skin effect, providing a better understanding of these metals' properties.
